title: What's in the New Budget?
summary: The government is planning a new budget with changes to taxes and wages. Chancellor Rachel Reeves wants to make the economy better by raising the minimum wage for workers. For example, adults over 21 will get Â£12.71 per hour in 2026. There's also a new tax on sugary milkshakes and milk drinks to make them healthier. The government hopes this will help reduce debt and improve the NHS. Reeves says these are fair choices to build a stronger Britain. The budget will be announced in the House of Commons, and the opposition leader will respond.

background_read: The Budget is a big plan made by the government every year to decide how to use money from taxes. It affects things like schools, hospitals, and jobs. In this case, the government wants to help people by raising wages and making drinks healthier with taxes. This is important because it can make life better for families and reduce waiting times for doctors.
Article_Structure: WHO: Chancellor Rachel Reeves and the government
WHAT: Announcing tax rises, minimum wage increases, and a milkshake tax
WHERE: In the House of Commons in the UK
WHY: To improve the economy, reduce debt, and make Britain fairer

perspectives.description: The changes are fair and necessary to help the country grow.
Higher wages might make it hard to hire people and could lead to job cuts.
